shortcontents.shortcontent:
I) Dawit “Psalter” (fols. 2r-150rb) I-1) Mäzmurä Dawit “Psalms of David” (fols. 2r-117r) I-2) Mäḥalǝyä näbiyat “The Canticles of the Prophets” (fols. 117r-129r) I-3) Mäḥalǝyä mäḥalǝy “Song of Songs” (fols. 129r-135v) I-4) Wǝddase Maryam “Praise of Mary” (fols. 136r-150vb) I-5) ʾAnqäṣä bǝrhan “The Gate of Light” (fols. 145rb-149rb)
Additiones 1-4.

copyists.copyist: The Ms. was produced by the same scribe as Ms. DD-030.

donors.donor: According to Additio 1, the Ms. belonged to Wäldä Giyorgis.

dcomments.dcomment: Second half of the 17th cent.-first half of the 18th cent. (?)

txstates.txstate: The boards are broken and repaired with strips of leather. The leather cover is for the most part missing; only the spine cover and the turn-ins remained. The tailband is partly torn off. Fol. 1 is a loose leaf. Many fols. are worn, stained with wax and water. Some fols. are damaged by rodents. Some fols. are falling apart along the vertical ruling: e.g., fols. 5, 6, 9, 28, 33, 34, 72, 142. Hols and tears amended on e.g., fols.: 11, 22-24, 31, 32, 39, 54, 63, 70, 71, 122, 123, 124.

bindings.binding: Two wooden boards (both broken and repaired) covered with leather (for the most part missing). Two pairs of sewing stations.

bnothers.bnother: Two pairs of chains of endband stitches at the spine cover. The turn-ins are laced with cords. Small reinforcing strips of parchment inserted under the threads holding the headband, in the middle of the quires: fols. 38, 78, 88, 98, 108, 118, 148. Quires I, II, VII and XI are reinforced by parchment guards. A short parchment guard is sewn in the middle of quire I.

txfolios.txfolio: Foliation mistake; the leaf after fol. 15 has been foliated as 17.

squires.squire:
A(1/fol. 1r-v) – I(10/fols. 2r-11v) – II(10/fols. 12r-22v) – III(10/fols. 23r-32v) – IV(10/fols. 33r-42v) – V(10/fols. 43r-52v) – VI(10/fols. 53r-62v) – VII(10/fols. 63r-74v) – VIII(10/fols. 75r-82v) – IX(10/fols. 83r-92v) – X(10/fols. 93r-102v) – XI(10/fols. 103r-112v) – XII(10/fols. 113r-122v) – XIII(10/fols. 123r-132v) – XIV(10/fols. 133r-142v) – XV(9/s.l.: 1 no stub; 8 stub after 7; 3 stub after 2/fols. 143r-151v).
The bifolio 127-128 is narrower.

taunit.mr-info: Texts: I-1, I-2, I-3: all data for fol. 3r.
taunit.rl-info: Ruling and pricking are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are mostly visible. Ruling pricks are visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

taunit.mr-info: Texts: I-5, I-6: all data for fol. 137r.
taunit.rl-info: Ruling and pricking are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks are visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

rulings.ruling: Ruling and pricking are visible. Ruling pattern: Texts I, II, III: 1A-1A/0-0/0-0/C; Texts IV, V:1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are mostly visible. Ruling pricks are visible. Structural pricks are partly visible (fol. 118). The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

ptypeofscripts.ptypeofscript: Second half of the 17th century-first half of the 18th century (?)

rubrications.rubrication:
Nomina sacra (name of St. Mary in Texts I-4 and I-5); titles and numbers of the Pss., Canticles and Songs; title of Texts I-4 and I-5; incipit of the daily readings of Text I-4; name and traditional interpretation of the Hebrew letters in Ps. 118; letter ስ in the word እስመ in Ps. 135; letters ባ and ክ of the word ይባርክዎ in Ps. 150 and in Canticle 10; refrains of Texts I-4 and I-5 (one or two initial words or their abbreviations); elements of the punctuation signs and text dividers; Ethiopic numerals or their elements.
A few lines on the incipit page of Text I-1; two lines on the incipit page of Texts I-2 and I-3; two groups of lines in Text I-4.

abbreviations.abbreviation: Text I-4: ሰ፤ ለ፤ ቅ for ሰአሊ፡ ለነ፡ ቅድስት Words or their abbreviations stand for the whole refrain. ሠ፡ for ሠረቀ፡ በሥጋ፡ እምድንግል፡ ዘእንበለ፡ ዘርአ፡ ብእሲ፡ ወአድኅነነ እ፡, እስ፡ for እስመ፡ በፈቃዱ፡ ወበሥምረቱ፡ አቡሁ፡ ወመንፈስ፡ ቅዱስ፡ መጽአ፡ ወአድኅነነ ተ፡ for ተፈሥሒ፡ ኦምልዕልተ፡ ጸጋ፡ ተፈሥሒ፡ እስመ፡ ረከብኪ፡ ሞገስ፡ ተፈሥሒ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ምስሌኪ Text I-5 ወ᎓ ሣ᎓ ይ᎓ ሰ᎓ ቅ᎓ for ወልድኪ፡ ሣህሎ፡ ይክፍለነ፡ ሰአሊ፡ ለነ፡ ቅድስት

otherdetails.otherdetail: - The traditional interpretation of some of the Hebrew letters in Ps. 118 is missing.

additional.add: Fol. 149rb: ዝመጽሐፍ፡ ዘወልደ፡ ጊዮርጊስ፡ ወለብእሲቱ፡ ንጽሐ፡ ድንግል፡ ወለውሉዱ፡ አርከ፡ ሥሉስ፡ አብለ፡ ሥሉስ። ዘሰረቆ፡ ወዘፈሐቆ፡ ዘእንበለ፡ ንዋይ፡ ውጕዘ፡ ለይኩን፡ ከመ፡ አርዮስ፡ በስልጣነ፡ ጴጥሮስ፡ ወጳውሎስ፡ ውጕዘ፡ ለይኩን፡
additional.tran: Fol. 149rb: This book belongs to Wäldä Giyorgis and his wife is Nǝṣḥa Dǝngǝl and his sons are ʾArkä Śǝllus [and] ʾAblä Śǝllus. He who will steal it or erase (its text) not being in its possession [?] shall be excommunicated like Arius, by the authority of Peter and Paul.
additional.det: The note states that the Ms. belongs to Wäldä Giyorgis. Also, his family members are mentioned: his wife Nǝṣḥa Dǝngǝl and two sons ʾArkä Śǝllus and ʾAblä Śǝllus.

additional.cont: Fols. 149va-150rb: ʾAkkonu bǝʾǝsi... “Does not the man...”.
additional.det: The text is written in a hand not much posterior to the main hand. Initial letters of the nomina sacra or their abbreviations are rubricated.

additional.cont: Fols. 150vab: Note on the symbolic meaning of the constituents of the temple.
additional.add: Fols. 150vab: በስመ፡ ነጠል፡ ፪፡ እደ፡ ዕርቅ፡ ሙሴና፡ ኢያሱ፡ ሰረገላ፡ አሮን፡ ምሰሶው፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ አብ፡ መቅደስ፡ እግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም፡ መቃን፡ ዮሴፍና፡ ኒቆዲሞስ፡ መድረክ፡ መቃብሩ፡ ክርስቶስ…
additional.det: The note is very crudely written in Amharic. Different parts of the church and its utensils are identified with God, Mary, angels and saints. Below the note, there is a hardly legible ownership note.

additional.cont: Fol. 151v: Mälkǝʿa Mikaʾel “Image of Michael”.
additional.det: S. ChRep no. 119, p. 198, BN éth. 60, ZotBNat 78, no. 69, 5.

extras.extra: - The title of the Ms. ዳዊት and the internal number of the monastic library (278) are written on fol. 2r. - The midpoint of the “Psalms of David” (here in Ps. 78) is marked with two asterisks on fol. 60r. - The scribe reduced the size of his handwriting to accommodate the end of the line: fols. 5v, 38r, 39r, 57r, 98r, 103r, 110v, 119v, 121r. - Part of the line is taken up: fols. 8r, 76r, 83v. - Omitted letters, words, lines or passages written interlineally, in a secondary hand: fols. 6r, 6v, 7v, 8r, 18v, 19r, 34r, 36v, 38v, 43r, 52v, 59r, 61v, 65v, 67r, 69r, 72v, 78r, 80r, 82v, 83v, 90v, 92r, 93v, 104v, 105r, 111r, 116v, 123r, 130r, 131v, 132r, 133r, 134v, 135r, 135v. - Corrections over erasures: fols. 42r, 55r. - Erasures: 11r, 20v, 22r, 24r, 29r, 32r, 38r, 47r, 59r, 64v, 65r, 91r, 102v, 110r, 111v, 112v, 124r, 133v, 134r.

txfindingaids.txfindingaid: - Daily reading of Text I-4 is indicated by the name of the day written in the upper margin: ዘሐሙስ: fol. 140r. - Coloured threads inserted in the right upper corner of fols. 8, 15, 23, 32, 54, 65, 72, 78, 90, 102, 105, 107, 117, 129. - The Pss. are divided into groups of ten separated by a line of alternating black and red dots. The division corresponds to the insertion of the coloured threads.
